results.title: Spartacus
results.creator_credit: Robert Lawrence, Stanley Kubrick, Edward Lewis, Bryna Productions and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Spartacus is a rousing testament to the spirit and dignity of man, dealing with a revolt by slaves against the pagan Roman Empire, based on the novel by Howard Fast.

constellations_other.name: Swords, sandals and lightning bolts
constellations_other.description: In Thor: Love and Thunder, Russell Crowe plays one of the most recogniseable gods in the pantheon – Zeus. His scenes lampoon his Oscar-winning role in Gladiator, one of the most recognised films in a classic genre.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Lawrence, Stanley Kubrick, Edward Lewis, Bryna Productions and Universal Pictures
results.description: Spartacus is a rousing testament to the spirit and dignity of man, dealing with a revolt by slaves against the pagan Roman Empire, based on the novel by Howard Fast. As a spectacle, the clash between the slave army led by Kirk Douglas, and the Romans commanded by Laurence Olivier, is nothing short of amazing. Douglas is the mainstay of the picture. He is not particularly expressive, in contrast to the sophisticated Olivier, the conniving parasite gladiator ring operator portrayed by Peter Ustinov or the supple and subtle slave maiden played by Jean Simmons. However, Douglas succeeds admirably in giving an impression of a man who is afire within. Some 8,000 Spanish soldiers became Roman legionaires for the massive battle sequences filmed outside Madrid, but the rest of the picture was made in Hollywood. Cast also includes Charles Laughton. Based on novel by Howard Fast.
description_for_label: Spartacus is a rousing testament to the spirit and dignity of man, dealing with a revolt by slaves against the pagan Roman Empire, based on the novel by Howard Fast. As a spectacle, the clash between the slave army led by Kirk Douglas, and the Romans commanded by Laurence Olivier, is nothing short of amazing. Douglas is the mainstay of the picture. He is not particularly expressive, in contrast to the sophisticated Olivier, the conniving parasite gladiator ring operator portrayed by Peter Ustinov or the supple and subtle slave maiden played by Jean Simmons. However, Douglas succeeds admirably in giving an impression of a man who is afire within. Some 8,000 Spanish soldiers became Roman legionaires for the massive battle sequences filmed outside Madrid, but the rest of the picture was made in Hollywood. Cast also includes Charles Laughton. Based on novel by Howard Fast.

results.title: Sparrow
results.creator_credit: Polly Watkins, Trish Carney, In Posse and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: A young family lives isolated in rural Australia with the father, a truckie, almost always away. Sparrow asks her mother what the difference is between ghosts and spirits as she ponders the death of the family dog. The mother remains emotionally distant until Sparrow’s curiosity with death leads her to dig up a family secret. ‘Sparrow’ explores the quiet of the emotions within a family and creates a portrait of emotional distance affirmed with the slow pace of country life and the very distant horizon. Cast includes: Molly McCaffrey and Leverne McDonnell.

results.title: Cooking of France: an alpine menu
results.creator_credit: Hal Weiner, Marilyn Weiner and Screenscope Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.
A film which demonstrates that fine French cuisine can be prepared simply, but elegantly, using basic skills and ingredients. Join the amiable Master Chef, Andre Revest, on a tour of his kitchen and his native Dauphiny Alps region.

results.title: Special treatment: locking up aboriginal children
results.creator_credit: Margaret Anne Smith and Smith Street Films
results.brief_description: Young Aboriginal people are no longer removed from their families by the authorities “for their own good”, but young Aborigines are still subject to forcible removal from their families and friends through imprisonment in juvenile prisons for petty crimes. This program focuses on the experiences of young Aborigines in New South Wales who tell of a high degree of police harassment, simply because they are black. Their views are in stark contrast to those held by the white law enforcers interviewed, who see themselves to be free of racism despite the fact that there is a massive over-representation of Aborigines in Australian prisons.

results.title: Italy: a Venetian menu
results.creator_credit: Hal Weiner, Marilyn Weiner and Screenscope Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.
In Venice eating is an event, and master chef Giovanni Giero shows you why. With great aplomb he prepares sauces, scampi, pasta and more. Filmed in and around the beautiful city of Venice.

results.title: Spain: a Catalonian menu
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.
People who live in areas with large Latin communities may be familiar with Spanish cooking. But the charming chef Carlos Sentis adds his personal touch and keen insights to the food of northern Spain. Includes the preparation of such Catalonian specialties as Sapa de Pescado and Chicken and Lobster Subur style.

results.title: Sounds of silence
results.creator_credit: Cliff Richards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: As a Victorian war veteran, Cliff Richards encapsulates his experiences during the war through the various sounds that assailed him. Sounds of helicopters, loud noises and, the one he feared the most, the sound of silence. He considers what the different sounds signify both for him and others and the way the everyday sounds of today can echo the horrors of the past.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cliff Richards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Watchkeepers
results.creator_credit: John Selwyn Gilbert, Channel Four, Antelope Films and Network Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Spaceship Earth”.
Satellite technology combined with computer graphics can present an enormous range of information about Spaceship Earth and its inhabitants. This information can be climatic, demographic, geographic, religious, horticultural, agricultural and social. This program reviews the range of information accessible via these combined technologies and with the help of the NASA computer examines the first “living portrait” of the earth.

results.title: Running water
results.creator_credit: John Selwyn Gilbert, Channel Four, Antelope Films and Network Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Spaceship Earth”.
Managing the rivers will be an important part of managing global climate changes. Using satellite technologies, this program visits the great river basins of the planet - the Nile, Amazon, Mississippi, Ganges, Danube and the Yellow River. These mighty watercourses have a profound influence on the people who conduct their daily life along their banks.
